transcripts.text: Speaking of your family, one of the things that we love about following you is how open you and Deval are about literally every part of y'all lives.  Like when y'all cool, when y'all not cool, when y'all good, when y'all not good.
We figure if we're going to tell y'all the story, we have to tell y'all the whole truth.  You know what I mean?  We can't start picking and choosing.  Exactly.
And you guys just launched a podcast.
Tell me a little bit about the podcast before we go into the topic of the day.
No, absolutely.  So it's Deadass with Kadena Novell.  I mean, very New York, very Brooklyn.

Deadass.  And we fought for that name because we knew what it meant for the culture, trying to hold on to a little bit of Brooklyn.  You know what I mean?  But we pretty much wanted to be able to give a voice to millennials through the lens of a millennial married couple with children.  So we discussed everything.  I mean, between marriage, love, finance, kids, everything under the sun.  We didn't want it to encompass just relationship issues or topics.  Right.  So, yeah, we're about seven episodes in.  It airs every Wednesday.  They show you subscribe where you listen and all that good stuff for podcasts.  So, so far, it's been great.

I'm so happy for you.  You guys are doing so well.  And what I love about y'all is that y'all are, like, one of the only millennial representations of, like, a really dope marriage that's, like, young and thriving but still has kids and's not trying to grow up.  So does that become a lot of pressure, like, that people look at y'all as kind of this, like, relationship goals millennial couple?

Yeah, we kind of like to shy away from the whole relationship goals because we feel like this works for us, you know?  And so many times people have asked us for advice.  Like, we do have listener letters.  People will write in and will give our advice, but we never want to put ourselves on a pedestal as if this is what people should aspire to do.  However, we do feel like it's important for us to show you can be an individual, you can support each other, you can goal chase, you can dream chase, you can have children, you can be a mom, you can bounce right back.  There's so many things that I want to show people, and my husband and I want to show people that we can do, that it is possible.  Is there a pressure around it?  A little bit.  But we don't get too involved in that.  We feel like we're also content creators.  Our YouTube channel, this really started with us trying to, as content creators and as actors, put our reel out there.  What better way to do it than on social media?  It's free, people have access, and now we've accessed so many people, and it's become kind of like this movement for us, inadvertently, that we didn't plan for, but we accept the challenge.
Well, let me ask you a question.  Since you're like our resident relationship expert on the show, Okay.
Well, you know, I ain't in relationships.  My mama told me.  You're the expert.  I mean, yes.  I'm about 17 years in.
That's what I'm saying.  Yeah, yeah, yeah.

That's what I'm saying.  So what if this open marriage thing, some people say it's a recipe for disaster.  Some people say it's the only thing that keeps their relationship healthy.  Some people say, you know, it might not be for you, but do you see it as a functional way to have a relationship?  I feel...

This is my take on it.  If it works for you and your spouse or your partner, so be it.  The biggest issue, I think, with a lot of relationships is having the outside noise that drowns what it is.  you two have decided on.  If this is what you decided on because it works for both of you and it makes you happy... Why?  Do it.  Do it.  So I would never sit here and judge and say, maybe it doesn't work for Daval and I to have an open relationship, but the farthest thing from our minds is to judge anybody who does decide on it.  I've heard that it's an oxymoron.  Why have a marriage if you're going to be open?  And in what terms is it open?  Is it just open sexually?  Is it open, you know, in terms of having a whole entire other relationship?  I know there was a show on, was it TLC?  Yeah.  Sister Why?  Seeking Sister Why?
Yeah, yeah, yeah.  There was a black couple on there.
There was a black couple on there.  Yeah.
